More Notes: The number of lost working days due to high temperature is expected to increase by this amount from an already high level of lost days per year.
Without adaptation, irrigated rice yields in the dry season could decrease substantially. Reference year is publication year.
Adaptation measures could lead to a lesser but still significant decrease in rice yields. Reference year is publication year.
Average annual losses due to climate variability. Lower bound estimate.
Average annual losses due to climate variability. Upper bound estimate.
Cumulative reduction over 30-year period. Lower bound estimate.
Cumulative reduction over 30-year period. Upper bound estimate.
Ratio of effect of climate variables (temperature and precipitation) against control variables and time trend (current-year ratio). The higher the number, the more important is climate variables.

Ratio of effect of climate variables (temperature and precipitation) against control variables and time trend (10-year lagged consequences). The higher the number, the more important is climate variables.
Ratio of effects of temperature and precipitation. The higher the number, the more important is temperature.
